rComments: Mrs Tawwab is something else: ustadha mumtaza!. I loved her lectures and her sense of humor. She creates good opportunities for students to do well. Her assignments actually help you learn the material. You end up learning how to think and speak about languages, not just memorizing vocabulary and conjugations and to put them in a test.

Probably one of the nicest and most patient professor i've ever had. She really puts an effort to help her students out. Class was a little difficult but she gives you a chance to improve in ways other than testing.

Prof. Tawwab is amazing. I am taking many ling courses and I can say that she is really good. The way she explains things helps me understand concepts from other courses that I never got before. the course is introductory but she makes it feel like the most important course ever. her slides are just super helpful; I hardly use the textbook.

This woman loves languages. She explains things so well it just makes sense when she says it. She expects you to work and she will get you to do your work. She is a good teacher but she also really cares about her students. She will get out of her way to help. Yes, I would take her courses. She is fair but she sets the bar high.

Professor, ustadha Tawwab is amazing. She is a competent teacher with high expectations. She is passionate about her work. Arabic is difficult, but she explains it so well . What I like most about her is that she respects students' feelings. She has her ways with students, and she knows like a hundred languages. Take her course, she is cool.

Samia Tawwab was a great prof. Learning a new language is never easy and she made it a little easier. She was always open to meet with students for extra help or was always just an email away. She was a very caring and patient. She kept the work load light and the lectures simple.

Dr. Tawwab was the reason of me having a passion in Italian. Even though I have no Italian background, the lectures were so easy to understand. She is very respectful and would never embarrass you. She also responds to emails really quick, and she is always happy to see students at the office hours. Take her class and you would never regret it!

My experience in ITA100 with Dr. Tawwab was nothing but positive. Despite Italian being the first language I've studied other than English, I had no problems understanding her, and was always helped through email or personal visits at her office. Show up to lecture, take good notes and you won't even need to study hard. Just practice.

At the beginning of the semester, she claimed that it is a course meant for italian beginners, having no background in the language-which is should be. However, she starts speaking full sentences in italian expecting you to understand. No formal teaching of how to build sentences and vocabulary. DON'T take if you don't have a background in italian.

Samia is really good and she loves what she does. Who would imagine when she is not even Italian. I never had a prof who cared that much about their students. She is efficient and kind. Way to go, signora!
If you go to class and pay attention you will do extremely well. She is AWSOME !
DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS IF YOU'RE NOT FROM AN ITALIAN BACKGROUND. she starts speaking in italian and expects you to understand .. but she brings food :) good prof if you have an italian background!
Helpful...then again the class is a very simple one. She is a nice lady but sometimes feels like we are still in highschool.
